Chelsea believe they can snatch Franck Kessie from Milan for around €40-50m, perhaps in part-exchange for Tiemoue Bakayoko.

According to Tuttomercatoweb and La Gazzetta dello Sport, Maurizio Sarri aims to make the most of the delicate financial situation the Rossoneri find themselves in.

The Ivorian just turned 22 last month and joined Milan from Atalanta on a loan deal worth €8m in 2017 with obligation to buy for a further €24m in July 2019.

That decision was made before the club’s change of ownership and stringent UEFA Financial Fair Play penalties.

With the deadline looming, Milan could make some quick cash by selling Kessie to the Premier League, where Chelsea are at a clear advantage over Tottenham Hotspur and Arsenal.

That is also because the San Siro side took Bakayoko on loan from Chelsea with a €35m option to buy at the end of the season.

Bakayoko started very badly, but has since grown to put in some solid performances, improving considerably under the tutelage of Gennaro Gattuso.

Chelsea could use this deal as leverage to pick up Kessie, although the proposal would have to be at least €40-50m.

Montolivo refusing to leave Milan
Despite being shoved to the sidelines even during an injury crisis, it’s reported Riccardo Montolivo is refusing to leave Milan in January.

According to La Gazzetta dello Sport, the midfielder intends to see out his contract until June 30 and then move on as a free agent.

He had been linked with Genoa, where he’d reunite with former Fiorentina and Italy Coach Cesare Prandelli.

Montolivo turns 34 later this month and has not made a single appearance for the Rossoneri this season.

Coach Gennaro Gattuso preferred to move full-back Davide Calabria into a midfield role during an injury crisis rather than call on the veteran’s services.

His agent claimed the player is not even being allowed to take part in training ground games between ranks.

Milan have agreed terms to pick up teenage Monaco left-back Leroy Abanda Mfomo as a free agent, claim Sky Sport Italia.

According to Sky Sport Italia, the 18-year-old who will be out of contract in June has given the all-clear to join the Rossoneri next summer.

He impressed in the UEFA Youth League this season, contributing two goals and three assists in 10 games for Monaco.

Abanda Mfomo has four caps for France at Under-17 level and can play in a more advanced role on the left wing too.

Milan, Juventus follow Werner

Timo Werner seems reluctant to renew his contract at RB Leipzig, so Juventus and Milan are monitoring the situation.

The German international has scored over 20 goals in the past two seasons, and so far this term he has 14 goals in 21 appearances across all competitions.

According to Fox Sports, the 22-year-old is reluctant to sign a new contract with his current club, and that has put some of Europe’s giants on alert.

Both Juve and Milan have been following him for some time, but with his current deal expiring in 2020 Leipzig would still ask for €60-70m.

Milan prefer Duncan to Sensi
Milan are interested in Alfred Duncan more than his Sassuolo teammate Stefano Sensi, it’s reported, with a €20m asking price.

The links with Sensi have been known for some time, but his €25m price-tag has proved a problem, while the Neroverdi are not eager to release him mid-season either.

According to Sportitalia, the Rossoneri are more likely to get a January deal for defensive midfielder Duncan.

He would cost slightly less, around €20m, and is believed to be enthusiastic about the possible move to San Siro.

Roma have also been linked with Duncan, but their interest is only passing.
